newsitem.title: UK: NWE heating oil firms, premiums stable.
newsitem.headline: NWE heating oil firms, premiums stable.

text.p: NWE gas oil prices firmed on benchmark IPE futures on Friday and premiums were steady despite increased supply of heating oil and mild autumn weather, traders said.
Nov IPE futures were trading up $2 at $225.75 a tonne in featureless, meagre business.
"Demand is sluggish. We need a bit colder weather," a German cargo trader said.
A cargo of Algerian was sold at Nov IPE +$24 cif NWE, unchanged from Thursday and traders reported buying interest into Britain for other low sulphur diesel at Dec +$23/34.
One cargo of heating oil for delivery Nov 10-20 was talked at IPE Dec +$5, one trader said.
Traders differed on the expected composition of around 200,000 tonnes of heating oil due from the U.S. in the next few days but agreed it would lead to a general easing of supply.
On the barge market, a parcel of refinery grade heating oil was traded at Nov IPE +$2 fob ARA. Diesel winter grade (-7/-22) was steady at Nov IPE +$31/32.
